English:
Lower-warp heddle stick around which a silk yarn
is wound
A silk yarn, used as a heddle

Shed  roll  inserted  between  the  upper  and  lower

Upper-warp heddle stick on which the upper warp yarns are wound around
A  round  stick  on  which  the  yarn  ends  are  wound around while winding the warp yarns

metal or bamboo rod which is of the desired length
of  the  cloth  to  be  woven  and  used  while  winding the warp yarns

Thin  and  round  sticks,  used  for  segregating  the

Thin, short and round sticks around which the weft
is wound
cloth/warp roll that is attached to a back strap.

Back strap  using which the  weaver  can  lean  back

Back strap  using which the  weaver  can  lean  back and use the body weight to tension the loom while weaving

The  rope  used  for  securing  the  back  strap  on  a

Beater, made from wood that pushes weft through

The metal bars that are fixed horizontally through the  holes  of  the  wooden  beam,  and  around  which
the warp yarns and the cloth slides through.

Two pieces of beams with a zig zag carvings on the upper portion, kept on both sides of the loom and
across which a piece of plank is placed to brace the feet upon while weaving.
A piece of rod or a plank placed across the bitan to brace the feed upon while weaving

A  pick-up  stick,  usually  made  of  aluminium  or wood, used for picking up the warp yarns to create
patterns.

A  pick-up  stick,  usually  made  of  aluminium  or
wood, used for picking up the warp yarns to create patterns.

A  flat  stick with  sharp  ends  which are  inserted at the breadth ends of a cloth just below the start of

Yarn, usually silk that is used for making patterns

Metals rods on which wheels are placed to hang the
heddles, which makes it easier to lift and lower the warp yarns
“Warp beam”,  roller  at the  end  of the loom,  on which the warp ends are wound for weaving, “cloth beam”, roller at the front of the loom, on which the woven cloth is wound
Reed,  a  steel  or  bamboo  comb  that  spaces  warp threads evenly and pushes weft into cloth.
Bench, a wooden plank to sit on while weaving
A square-shaped heddle, usually made from X-ray films  and  particularly  used  for  weaving  belts.  A warp yarn runs through each of the four small holes on the heddle
Wings  of  the  yarn  swift,  portion  of  a  yarn  swift excluding the stand
A post of the yarn swift
A device to make a yarn skein
A yarn basket, usually made of bamboo
Brush, to make yarn from the wool
Cloth to be woven on a loom
Cloth to be woven on a loom
Number of woven cloth pieces required to have a complete cloth of desired size

A chain-like pattern made at the width-edges of the

Thrums, unwoven warp left when the last woven piece is cut from the loom
Stripe of different colours with fewer numbers of warp yarn
Intricate Pattern on a woven cloth
A pattern made by segregating the warp yarns
Sunshine with a little bit of drizzling

Imperial surya chili or indian chili
